      • parallelQuicksortDescending

        public static void parallelQuicksortDescending(double[] main,
                                               double[] indices)
        Sort parallel arrays. Arrays are sorted in-place. The first array determines the order, and is sorted into descending order.

        Implementation inspired by this stackoverflow page: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/951848/java-array-sort-quick-way-to- get-a-sorted-list-of-indices-of-an-array

        Parameters:
        main - the values to use for determining the order
        indices - the second array

      • parallelQuicksortDescending

                                               double[] indices,
                                               int left,
                                               int right)
        Sort parallel arrays. Arrays are sorted in-place. The first array determines the order, and is sorted into descending order.

        Implementation inspired by this stackoverflow page: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/951848/java-array-sort-quick-way-to- get-a-sorted-list-of-indices-of-an-array

        Parameters:
        main - the values to use for determining the order
        indices - the second array
        left - the starting index
        right - the ending index

                                               int left,
                                               int right)
        Sort parallel arrays. Arrays are sorted in-place. The first array determines the order, and is sorted into descending order.

        Implementation inspired by this stackoverflow page: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/951848/java-array-sort-quick-way-to- get-a-sorted-list-of-indices-of-an-array

        Parameters:
        main - the values to use for determining the order
        indices - the second array
        left - the starting index
        right - the ending index

        Implementation inspired by this stackoverflow page: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/951848/java-array-sort-quick-way-to- get-a-sorted-list-of-indices-of-an-array

        Parameters:
        main - the values to use for determining the order
        indices - the second array

        main - the values to use for determining the order
        indices - the second array
        left - the starting index
        right - the ending index

                                              double[] indices)

      • quickSelect

        public static double quickSelect(double[] arr,
                                 int n)
        Quick Select algorithm for getting the nth item from the array as if it were sorted. Expected complexity is O(N); worst case is O(N^2). The input array will be reordered; clone it first if this is a problem. Implementation based on public domain code from Nicolas Devillard.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

      • quickSelect

        public static double quickSelect(double[] arr,
                                 int n,
                                 int low,
                                 int high)
        Quick Select algorithm for getting the nth item from a sub-array as if it were sorted. Expected complexity is O(N); worst case is O(N^2). The input array will be reordered; clone it first if this is a problem. Implementation based on public domain code from Nicolas Devillard.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        low - the starting position in the array (inclusive)
        high - the ending position in the array (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

      • quickSelect

        public static float quickSelect(float[] arr,
                                int n)
        Quick Select algorithm for getting the nth item from the array as if it were sorted. Expected complexity is O(N); worst case is O(N^2). The input array will be reordered; clone it first if this is a problem. Implementation based on public domain code from Nicolas Devillard.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

      • quickSelect

        public static float quickSelect(float[] arr,
                                int n,
                                int low,
                                int high)
        Quick Select algorithm for getting the nth item from a sub-array as if it were sorted. Expected complexity is O(N); worst case is O(N^2). The input array will be reordered; clone it first if this is a problem. Implementation based on public domain code from Nicolas Devillard.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        low - the starting position in the array (inclusive)
        high - the ending position in the array (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

      • quickSelect

        public static int quickSelect(int[] arr,
                              int n,
                              int low,
                              int high)
        Quick Select algorithm for getting the nth item from a sub-array as if it were sorted. Expected complexity is O(N); worst case is O(N^2). The input array will be reordered; clone it first if this is a problem. Implementation based on public domain code from Nicolas Devillard.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        low - the starting position in the array (inclusive)
        high - the ending position in the array (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"

      • quickSelect

                               int n)

        Parameters:
        arr - the array to select from
        n - the item to select
        Returns:
        the selected item
        See Also:
        "http://ndevilla.free.fr/median/median/src/quickselect.c"
